intro: Polycnemum heuffelii, commonly known as the Heuffel's common nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Polycnemum heuffelii is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
